data: When I was a child and was being fractious and contrary and generally behaving badly, my mother used to rebuke me by saying: “One day someone will come and kill me and then you’ll be sorry”; or, “They’ll appear out of the blue and whisk me away—how would you like that?”; or, “You’ll wake up one morning and I’ll be gone. Disappeared. You wait and see.”

WHEN I WAS A child and was being fractious and contrary and generally behaving badly, my mother used to rebuke me by saying: “One day someone will come and kill me and then you’ll be sorry”; or, “They’ll appear out of the blue and whisk me away—how would you like that?”; or, “You’ll wake up one morning and I’ll be gone. Disappeared. You wait and see.”
